Examples In this chapter we provide some simple examples of the use of FinInG. A simple example to get you started In this example, we consider a hyperoval of the projective plane PG(2,4), that is, six points no three collinear. We will construct such a hyperoval by exploring a bit the particular properties of the projective plane PG(2,4). The projective plane is initalised, its points are computed and listed; then a standard frame is constructed, of which we may assume that it is a subset of the hyperoval. Finally, the stabiliser group of the hyperoval is computed, and it is checked that this group is isomorphic with the symmetric group on six elements. <#Include SYSTEM "../examples/include/examples_hyperoval24_commented.include"> Polar Spaces Lines meeting a hermitian curve Here we see how the lines of a projective plane PG(2,q^2) PG(2,q2 ) meet a hermitian curve. It is well known that every line meets in either 1 or q+1 points. <#Include SYSTEM "../examples/include/examples_hermitian.include"> W(3,3) inside W(5,3) In this example, we embed W(3,3) in W(5,3). <#Include SYSTEM "../examples/include/examples_embedW.include"> Spreads of W(5,3) A spread of W(5,q) is a set of q^3+1q3+1 planes which partition the points of W(5,q). Here we enumerate all spreads of W(5,3) which have a set-wise stabiliser of order a multiple of 13. <#Include SYSTEM "../examples/include/examples_spreads.include"> The Patterson ovoid In this example, we construct the unique ovoid of the parabolic quadric Q(6,3), first discovered by Patterson, but for which was given a nice construction by E. E. Shult. We begin with the ``sums of squares'' quadratic form over GF(3) and the associated polar space. <#Include SYSTEM "../examples/include/examples_patterson_commented.include"> Elation generalised quadrangles The classical q-clan In this example, we construct a classical elation generalised quadrangle from a q-clan, and we see that the associated BLT-set is a conic. <#Include SYSTEM "../examples/include/examples_qclan.include"> Two ways to construct a flock generalised quadrangle from a Kantor-Knuth semifield q-clan We will construct an elation generalised quadrangle directly from the Kantor-Knuth semifield q-clan and also via its corresponding BLT-set.
